text: Who proposed the cell theory along with Matthias Schleiden?
Which cell organelle is known as the 'powerhouse of the cell'?
In plant cells, the cell wall is mainly composed of:
Which of the following is a double-membrane-bound organelle?
State the cell theory in brief.
answer: All living organisms are made of cells; the cell is the basic unit of life; cells arise from pre-existing cells.

text: What is the function of ribosomes?
Give two examples of prokaryotic organisms.
Describe the structure and functions of the nucleus.
answer:
Structure: Double membrane-bound organelle with nuclear envelope, nucleoplasm, chromatin, and nucleolus.
Functions: Stores genetic material (DNA), controls cell activities, regulates protein synthesis, cell division.

text: Differentiate between prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells.
answer:
Prokaryotic: No true nucleus, circular DNA, small ribosomes (70S), no membrane-bound organelles.
Eukaryotic: True nucleus, linear DNA with histones, large ribosomes (80S), membrane-bound organelles present.
